content.body: zcorpan: any idea when we can make progress on https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/issues/27868?
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: any idea when we can make progress on https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/issues/27868?

content.body: Luke Warlow: is there a spec issue for positioning the popup for `showPicker()` when the control is not rendered?
content.formatted_body: Luke Warlow: is there a spec issue for positioning the popup for showPicker() when the control is not rendered?

content.body: There isn't yet. I'm going to make a follow up one to discuss it

Is there any precedent on the platform for something that takes a bunch of callbacks and calls them in LIFO order? Things like addEventListener seem to be the norm, where a collection of callbacks are all invoked in insertion order, right?

* Is there any precedent on the platform for something that takes a bunch of callbacks and calls them in LIFO order (in response to something arbitrary)? Things like addEventListener seem to be the norm, where a collection of callbacks are all invoked in insertion order, right?

m.new_content.body: Is there any precedent on the platform for something that takes a bunch of callbacks and calls them in LIFO order (in response to something arbitrary)? Things like addEventListener seem to be the norm, where a collection of callbacks are all invoked in insertion order, right?

content.body: Dominic Farolino: prolly, but also we don't have a lot of callbacks
content.formatted_body: Dominic Farolino: prolly, but also we don't have a lot of callbacks

content.body:
> <@zcorpan:mozilla.org> Luke Warlow: is there a spec issue for positioning the popup for `showPicker()` when the control is not rendered?

https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9942 just opened one
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @zcorpan:mozilla.org
Luke Warlow: is there a spec issue for positioning the popup for showPicker() when the control is not rendered?
https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9942 just opened one
